content.description: Climb the right arete. Only three bolts, makes this feel harder than it actually is. This is one of the routes in this area that doesn't seem sandbagged. About as hard as Chantilly Lace.
content.location: Approaching McQ's Pinnacle from the South, head to the right (east) side.

content.description: Start with a bouldery move over a bulge, but with good hands.  Then clip two bolts beside the wide crack above the bulge, before following a finger/hand crack (medium cams) to the top.
content.protection: Two bolts, and a couple of medium cams to protect the crack.  Anchors for rappeling at the summit of the thin fin, about 8 feet farther up the ridge line from where the climb hits the top.
content.location: Vigilante is at the far southeast corner of the Thin Fin.

content.description: Climb the arete. At the fourth bolt, you can either go up and then right or right and then up. Going right seemed easier to me, but both are under 10a.
content.location: The left arete on the pinnacle.

content.description: Another sweet beginner route at a crag that has more than its share of those. A little thoughtful figuring out how to get on the route, but then just fun flowing moves up a face, to a flake, to a slabby, airy finish. Big flake seemed solid to pull on but quite hollow. Wouldn’t trust gear placed behind it. Stick clipping bolt # 1 took that issue off the board.
content.protection: Mixed 3 bolts plus nuts, cams, stoppers to #4.
content.location: A bit hard to find. Isolated around the back of Moonlight Ridge’s 2nd area. Way down left from Kor-Dination but a bit right of the gully.

content.description: Start near the flake and climb the center of the face. Nothing hard or interesting about this route. Shares anchors with Vindication.
content.protection: None. Top rope from the anchors of Vindication.

content.description: Follow a left facing flake up and to the right placing gear.  At the top of the flake clip a bolt, move right (possibly placing more gear) and then up a crack.  From the top of the cleft, face climb past two more bolts to the anchor.
content.protection: Small to medium cams and nuts.  3 bolts + chain anchors on top.
content.location: Left facing flake approx 15 feet left of a wide crack/corner system near the north end of McQ's Pinnacle's west face.  The crack system between this route and the wide crack/corner is Chewy's Tumble.

content.description: Top rope from the anchors of Chantilly Lace. Climb the center of the face 10 feet right of Chantilly Lace. At the green stuff, move right to join the right arete.
content.location: Ten feet right of Chantilly Lace.

content.description: Climb the easy (5.4ish) crack, placing gear as desired (#1 to #3 cams), to a mantle on top of the  protruding rock that forms the crack, clip one bolt while standing on the rock then make one or two moves of 5.6 or 5.7 (height dependent) to reach the summit crest.  Move left along the summit crest for 10 feet to anchor chains.  (See photo).
content.protection: 1 bolt, and a couple of cams as desired in the easily protected crack.  Two anchor chains on the to rappel from the summit ridge 10 feet left of the top of the climb.
content.location: The short crack on McQ's Pinnacle immediately left of the Thin Fin and Chantilly Lace start.

content.description: Start up a crack system just left of a wide crack/corner on the north end of McQ's west face.  Near the top of the crack, clip a couple bolts and move up and slightly left past one more bolt to the anchors.
content.protection: Small to medium cams and nuts, a few quickdraws for the bolts + chain anchors.
content.location: Just left of a wide crack/corner system near the north end of McQ's Pinnacle's west face.

content.description: On the west face, climb the left arete. Easy, but run-out climbing. A little heady getting to the last bolt. Crux is between the last bolt and anchors.
content.location: Just before you get to the fallen tree in the second area.

climbs.name: Bend Over & Show Me Your Me Your Darkside

content.description: A bit run out at the start if leading directly, but the holds are bomber and plentiful. You could also TR , as this is the lower line for E-Clips. While BO&SMYD is a crack climb , there are face holds everywhere as well. Mellow and low angle— major thought is which great hold do I grab or step on. 5.7 in the guidebook, but I thought 5.5. I split the difference here.  Fun beginner climb.
content.location: Left of E Clips in center of face.

content.description: This section of Moonlight Ridge lies between The Galaxy and The Point/Beside the Point formations.  The well named Thin Fin is the first formation encountered when approaching from downhill.  A dead tree rest between Thin Fin.
